page.title: 18Farming_Sheep_Portstown
page.content: The farms of Portstown and Roundhaugh lie to the west of Inverurie.Mr Cassie,the present owner's main enterprise is breeding Dorset lambs although he also has a herd of 60 cattle.He buys his ewes at either Aberdeen or Inverness at a cost of approx. Â£65_Â£80 per ewe.This year his flock produced 400 lambs,which works out at approx.1.75 lambs per ewe.The lambs are fattened and sold as milk lambs as soon as they come off their mother's milk.Both lambs and cattle are sold to the local abattoir, McIntosh of Inverurie. 250 acres are used to grow barley and grass.Some barley is kept as winter fodder,the rest is sold to grain merchants as cattle feed.Mr Cassie also grows dwarf peas to feed to his sheep because of their high vitamin content.
